intro: Pastinaca candolleana, commonly known as the Candolleana scorzonera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for its distinctive appearance.
